outputs.output_descr:
Project outputs: 
- Capacity of the CoES to predict, prevent and manage natural disasters is improved.
- CoES provides emergency management and related trainings in accordance with international standards
- Disaster risk management is integrated into planning at local levels

The project is aimed at provision of support to the Government of Tajikistan and international community in the implementation of the National Disaster Risk Management Strategy through establishment of the National Platform for DRR, improvement of disaster risk management activities coordination and disaster response at all levels through national and regional REACT and strengthened CoES capacities.
outputs.output_title: Support to DRR policy in TJK

outputs.output_descr: The project will focus on supporting the national authorities in development, implementation coordination and monitoring of post-earthquake recovery, quality assurance of an d technical advice to REACT partners  and UNDP recovery activities in the Rasht valley and improvement of the damage and needs assessment (DNA) processes in Tajikistan.

Description: The project is aimed to support the Committee of Emergency Situations to further develop and improve the existing joint telecom service as part of the overall emergency information management system

Description: The overall goal of the intervention (project impact) is to contribute to effective DRR in Tajikistan through the systematic inclusion of holistic and streamlined DRR policy into development strategies.

In frames of the project a range of activities will be undertaken focusing on the policy level promotion of Disaster Risk Reduction into development and pre-disaster recovery planning, complemented with local level disaster recovery and risk reduction interventions with identification of existing risks and issuance of early warnings.

project_descr: The overall objective of DRM Programme is to "decrease the risk of natural and man-made hazards to rural and urban livelihoods, and ensure infrastructure and recovery mechanisms in place".
